overview: In the summer of '53, an expatriated trio of young Americans founded the international literary quarterly, The Paris Review. Guided by George Plimpton, we roam the streets and caf√©s of Paris, glimpse the expatriate literati world of the 50s and 60s, and step into the bustling New York offices of the Review, meeting people, past and present, who remain central to this singular literary endeavor.
title: The Paris Review...: Early Chapters
